entry.title: Creating A Custom Range Input That Looks Consistent Across All Browsers
entry.summary: Range inputs have notoriously been a pain to style. Each browser renders the input differently requiring you to use vendor prefixes in order to create a cohesive look and feel. In this article, we‚Äôll take a look at the quirkiness of the HTML range input and demonstrate how to style the input to look consistent across all major browsers.

entry.title: Useful UX Guidelines, Tools And Resources
entry.summary: A meaningful user experience is what can set your site apart from others. But what makes an experience truly meaningful? And how to achieve that? The tools, tips, and resources in this post not only help you to come up with a UX strategy that works for you and your team but also to circumvent potential UX pitfalls.

entry.title: Designing Human-Machine Interfaces For Vehicles Of The Future

In this article, let‚Äôs look at some ways to help us satisfy users‚Äô needs with proper design.

entry.title: Modifying Headers In HTTP(s) Requests In UI Automation Testing
entry.summary: To be able to modify headers in a testing environment is a great thing to have. It allows control over your application as one can bypass authentication, set cookies, and so on.
